criteria: Clarity and Accuracy of Information Conveyed
Use of Resources and Support Systems
descriptions: Information presented is unclear, inaccurate, or irrelevant to reproductive and sexual health.
Information presented is somewhat unclear or contains minor inaccuracies.
Information is generally clear and accurate but lacks detail.
Information is clear, mostly accurate, and provides some relevant details.
Information is clear, accurate, and provides relevant details, demonstrating a good understanding of the topic.
Information is exceptionally clear, accurate, detailed, and demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of reproductive and sexual health.
Communication is ineffective; the student struggles to convey the message or engage in a meaningful discussion.
Communication is somewhat ineffective; the student has difficulty expressing ideas clearly.
Communication is moderately effective; the student conveys the message adequately but may lack confidence or clarity.
Communication is generally effective; the student conveys the message clearly and engages in a discussion.
Communication is effective; the student conveys the message clearly, engages in a thoughtful discussion, and demonstrates active listening skills.
Communication is highly effective; the student conveys the message with exceptional clarity, engages in a meaningful and insightful discussion, and demonstrates strong interpersonal skills.
Communication is inappropriate, disrespectful, or insensitive to the audience or topic.
Communication is occasionally inappropriate or shows a lack of sensitivity.
Communication is generally appropriate and respectful but may lack awareness of nuances.
Communication is appropriate, respectful, and demonstrates an awareness of the audience.
Communication is consistently appropriate, respectful, and demonstrates a high level of sensitivity to the audience and topic.
Communication is exceptionally appropriate, respectful, and demonstrates a deep understanding of the audience's needs and concerns, fostering a positive and supportive environment.
The student does not identify or utilize appropriate resources or support systems.
The student identifies but does not effectively utilize resources or support systems.
The student identifies and attempts to utilize resources or support systems with limited success.
The student identifies and utilizes appropriate resources or support systems.
The student effectively utilizes appropriate resources and support systems, demonstrating resourcefulness.
The student skillfully utilizes a variety of resources and support systems, demonstrating resourcefulness and initiative in seeking help.
